page.description: Extracts a property from a JSON object.
page.prototype: C text = json_extract(json_text as C, property_name as C)

argument.name: json_text
argument.description: A string that contains the JSON object to search.

argument.name: property_name
argument.description: The name of the property to find and extract from the JSON object.

page.discussion: The JSON text passed to the function must be properly formed (i.e. use double quotes on property and string names). You can use json_reformat_safe() to 'clean' up the JSON string before calling json_extract.
page.example:
dim json as c json = <<%txt% { name: 'Fred', address: { street: '123 Main St', city: 'Boston', state: 'MA' } } %txt%
'json_extract() requires properly formed JSON, so 'we first call json_reformat_safe() dim json2 as c json2 = json_reformat_safe(json)
?json_extract(json2,"name") = "Fred"
?json_extract(json2,"address") = { "street": "123 Main St", "city": "Boston", "state": "MA" }
